Logos for NetBSD

NetBSD logos for inclusion on your site (top)

If your web server runs on a NetBSD box, then why not include one of the NetBSD logos. (Please note that the daemon image is (c) copyrighted by Marshall Kirk McKusick)

How to download the images (top)

The first step in the process is to download one of the above images. Some of the more common options are:

  • Graphical browsers - navigator / mozilla / Mosaic / grail / chimera
    In Navigator, Mozilla and Grail, right-click (or left-click depending on your orientation) on the image to bring up the pop-up menu. Click the "Save Image As..." option to download it ("Save Image image name..." in Grail).

    In Mosaic, also bring up the pop-up menu that same way. Then you'll have to move the mouse over the "Image" option and click "Save" on the sub-menu to download it.

    And finally, to download the logos in Chimera, either middle click on the image you want, or click on it and save it in the external program you have set up.

  • Text Browsers - lynx / links / w3m
    In Lynx or Links, type "d" when you have the alt text of the image you want highlighted.

    In w3m, type "ESC I" when the cursor is over the alt text of the image you want.

  • NetBSD's ftp client
    Typing "ftp URL" will download the logo you want (eg; ftp http://www.netbsd.org/images/logos/sitedrivenby.gif).

Suggested HTML for your page (top)

The second step is to add the following to your page: 
   <a href="http://www.netbsd.org/">
        <img src="path_to.gif" border=0
             alt="Site driven by NetBSD - NetBSD
rules!"></a>
After you've done that, and if your web server does run on NetBSD, why not have a look at adding yourself to the Sites running NetBSD listing.
If you have a logo you would like to contribute, please let us know!
